titlStmt.titl: Unpassed Legislation Relating to Indian Affairs; Senate Unpassed Legislation 1837, Docket 10176, SC1/series 592x, Petition of Nathan Pocknet

setAvail.collSize: Single petition scanned as one or more 11x17 images.

stdyInfo.abstract:
Petition: Concerning property

Original: http://nrs.harvard.edu/urn-3:FHCL:12208741

Date of creation: 1837-01-28

Petition location: Marshpee

Legislator, committee, or address that the petition was sent to: Elijah Swift, Boston; several names from a committee

Top signatures:

  1. Nathan Pocknet
  2. Isaac Simon
  3. Abraham Jackson
  4. Jube Severs

Actions taken on dates: 1837-02-17,1837-02-17

Legislative action: Received in the House on February 17, 1837 and referred to a committee and sent for concurrence and received in the Senate on February 17, 1837 and concurred.

Total signatures: 17

Legislative action summary: Received, referred, sent, received, concurred

Females of color signatures: 1

Males of color signatures: 16

Identifications of signatories: signers, proprietors, [males of color], [females of color], ["others"]

Prayer format was printed vs. manuscript: Manuscript

Signatory column format: not column separated

Additional non-petition or unrelated documents available at archive: additional documents available

Acknowledgements: Supported by the National Endowment for the Humanities (PW-5105612), Massachusetts Archives of the Commonwealth, Radcliffe Institute for Advanced Study at Harvard University, Center for American Political Studies at Harvard University, Institutional Development Initiative at Harvard University, and Harvard University Library.
